FuncDef:
The resource-template command creates or modifies a resource template.
undo resource-template command deletes a resource template.
If no resource template is assigned, a VS uses the default resource template.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a resource template.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-insensitive characters. The string can contain letters, digits, underscores (_), and hyphens (-). The resource template name must begin with letters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Logical resources include u4route, m4route, u6route, m6route, vpn-instance, mcast, mpls and vlan. You can assign logical resources using either of the following methods:
Run the resource command in the VS view to assign a logical resource to a VS each time.Use a resource template to assign multiple logical resources to a VS in a batch. To create or modify a resource template, run the resource-template command.

Follow-up Procedure
After you create a resource template, run the resource command in the resource template view to configure the resource template.
After the configuration is complete, run the assign resource-template command to specify the resource template for the VS.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
After you specify a resource template for a VS, modify resource items in the template. The modification takes effect on the VS only after you run the assign resource-template command to specify the template for the VS.
